title: 115_hr4661
content: The Act titled "United States Fire Administration, AFG, and SAFER Program Reauthorization Act of 2017" reauthorizes the United States Fire Administration and assistance to firefighters grants program until fiscal year 2023. It also extends the sunset date for the Fire Prevention and Safety Grants Program to September 30, 2024. The Act extends the authorization of appropriations for the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act until 2023. It also includes specialized training for first responders to recognize and intervene with individuals with mental illness. SEC. 4. REAUTHORIZATION OF STAFFING FOR ADEQUATE FIRE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE GRANT PROGRAM. The amendment extends the authorization of appropriations for the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act until September 30, 2024. It also includes modifications to application requirements and limitations for the grant program. Modification of Limitation and Waiver Authority in the Federal Fire Prevention and Control Act of 1974, as well as the Expansion of Staffing for Adequate Fire and Emergency Response Grant Program, are amended to update application requirements and grant usage. SEC. 5. TRAINING ON ADMINISTRATION OF FIRE GRANT PROGRAMS. The Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency may develop an online training course for the fire and emergency response community on grant administration. SEC. 6. FRAMEWORK FOR OVERSIGHT AND MONITORING OF THE ASSISTANCE TO FIREFIGHTERS GRANTS PROGRAM, THE FIRE PREVENTION AND SAFETY GRANTS PROGRAM, AND THE STAFFING FOR ADEQUATE FIRE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE GRANT PROGRAM. The Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency will develop a grant monitoring framework within 90 days to prevent fraud and abuse in the grants programs. The framework required for oversight and monitoring of grants programs includes standardized guidance, training, risk assessments, desk reviews, site visits, enforcement actions, and other tools to prevent fraud and abuse.
